clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of the Rapid Intravascular Start (RIVS) System Versus Conventional Catheter
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Effectiveness of the Rapid Intravascular Start (RIVS) System Versus Conventional Catheter for Peripheral Intravenous (PIV) Insertion in Children, Oncology Patients and Elderly: a Controlled Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The study will test a hypothesis that the RIVS system will have a higher rate of successful first PIV placement compared to conventional catheter without a significant increase in complications and time of procedure.

detailed_description.textblock: The hypothesis to be statistically tested was that the RIVS system will have a higher rate of successful first attempt peripheral intravenous placement success as compared to conventional peripheral intravenous catheters without a significant increase in device related complications and procedure time.

primary_outcome.measure: First attempt IV success rate, time of procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of attempts required to complete a successful IV start

intervention.description: Vascular access using conventional venous access device
